intro: Nigritella stiriaca, commonly known as the Stiriaca bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Europe. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family, characterized by its bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in alpine or subalpine environments. Its leaves are lanceolate and covered in a fine, hairy texture, while its flowers are blue to violet in color. Nigritella stiriaca is relatively rare and is often found in small, isolated populations due to its specific habitat requirements.
